name: Brooklyn H
text: I was recommended and I myself, would recommend. It took about 2 1/2 weeks to get everything we NEEDED done. they were very upfront about the cost, how long it would take, and gave us a run down of everything that needed repaired & basically a general overview. We got what we originally came for the first week & after they noticed a few minor issues, we had them fixed within the next week. Still needs work but they got us up and running! they recommend affordable places to buy parts as well. I am confident that this business will give you the best work and if they feel they can’t, they will recommend you somewhere that can!

resp.text: Thank you

name: Bloody Hatchetz
text: Had a vehicle towed from my house to Integrity cause of it not running . This car didn't have much problems only needed parts put on that I already had that I stored in car . My car sat in there parking lot for 2 weeks and was not touched by them . I did call them 3 times asking for any updates and was told by them  it would be done on a Monday . I waited till Friday of same week and got fed up on waiting . I had another shop come with there towing truck . I would not recommend  Integrity ! They are also rude as I was only wanting updates.  They told me if I could do it faster then come get it so I did .

name: PB and J Aquatics
text: They lie and delay.  Don't take your vehicle there if you expect to use it for several months .  Mine sat there so long that mice made a nest in the wiring harness.

name: alice gaylor
text:
I am purchasing a new (used) vehicle that is in need of some repairs and Integrity is where the car lot took it to be serviced. I stopped by today (my first time ever being there) to check on the progress and was VERY impressed. Although my car isn't ready, Ryan and a couple of other employees were SO helpful and informative about everything going on with it. I never felt rushed or like I was being a burden for stopping by. As a matter of fact, they were trying to get the air in my truck going for me so I would have AC until my car gets fixed!! Unfortunately it wasn't able to be fixed but just the kindness and courtesy these guys showed was refreshing!!! I will definitely be using them for my go to shop from now on!!

****Updated Review****

HUGE shout out to the employees at Integrity!!! All the way from Robert, to Liz, Brian, and Doug.....you guys absolutely rock!!!!! Not only have you guys fixed the original car issues, but you helped me get the other things taken car of as well. I was greeted with a smile and excellent customer service EVERY time I stopped in and have nothing but praise for you guys!! Thanks so much for everything!!!

name: Jamie Allison
text: well they lie a lot and they just don’t do good business so I do not recommend I hope whoever sees this goes to someone better do not trust them up there we had our car up there and they messed everything up so just go to someone better🙂

name: Draco Palioxis
text: I had my car taken up here to get the Rack and Pinion and 2 rims fixed. They did all this unnecessary work like fix my bumper that wasnt broken and repainted my car for no reason. I have had this car in there for about a month now and I finally get a call from my insurance, NOT THE COMPANY MY CAR IS WITH, telling me that my car was totaled. And now I have no car in order to do my job in anymore. I highly would not recommend this place for any sort of repairs or fixing of your vehicles.

name: Mark Lanier
text: 5 star service. They will have all my vehicle maintenance work from here on out. I had my truck towed to them they had the problem diagnosed and fixed by the next afternoon. They called and let me know what was going on and what it would take to fix before doing anything. They took all my warranty so my cost was just the deductible from my warranty. Great people and customer service.

name: Josh Mckleroy
text: Had transmission rebuilt in September of 2019 had to take it back 2 days later because it was leaking fluid where the transmission bolts to the transfer case. Then around Christmas I realized the 4 wheel drive didn't work called up there and was told someone would call me back and they never did and done this multiple times for the next year and in November 2020 the transmission has went completely out after 14 months and 16000 miles owner blocked me on social media because he knows he has done wrong and hopefully by sharing my experience I can save someone the hassle and money so they don't waste $1800 like it did

name: P M
text: Not sure why the rating for this business is so high. As a mechanic I can say that I have seen some terrible work come from this shop, and I have seen some very upset customers who have lost thousands of dollars by trusting these guys. I’m making this post because today I ran across a third car they “worked on” and for the third time the repair they performed was unnecessary, and did not fix the issue. And for the second time, the work they did actually caused additional issues.

name: Karen Patterson
text: Super place too have work done on your car! Friendly, helpful staff and the work performed  is always priced reasonably and completed in a good time frame. I only have 1 vehicle so I can't wait several days or more for my car to be repaired. I've used Integrity for a couple of years now and am always satisfied with the quality of the work performed and the cost for same.

name: Chris Holmes
text: This morning I dropped off my car at 9 by 1030 they had my oil changed and air fixed.  I was a walk in and was blown away by their customer service.  There was no profanity or nasty jokes that you typically hear at a shop. They truly live up to their name. They also fixed my blinker for free. Hands down best place to work on your vehicle. I want be going anywhere else from now on. Highly recommend

name: Anthony Durante
text: They do a real  good job!

name: Beth Condit
text: The people were very nice but we were charged over $1000 and we still had the issue when we picked the truck up. When we went back in they told us it was something else and would cost over $400 to get that repair done. They misdiagnosed the issue and wanted us to pay for another costly repair. I will not be using them again. They also did not disclose there is a 4% charge for using a credit card until after the repair was done.

resp.text:
Not true at all. Your truck needed a new rack , alignment and brakes was gone on the front. I talk to your husband and told him after we fix the know problems we found you also needed a clock spring. And as far as the charge on the credit card company I also talk to your husband about that. Their are signs in the service department hanging and on back of the computes about credit card company.
I'm sorry you feel the way you do. We could have fixed the clock spring but also talked to your husband about that.
My name is Robert I'm the owner of the shop I'm asking you to give me a call about this 2567354000
We can only fix what the customers allow us to fix.
Good thing is still have front rotors and pads that was on truck and the rack also so your more than welcome to come see them.

name: Amber Jones
text: We used them one time to get a radiator hose replaced. They told us they would also do a full inspection and call us to let us know if there was or wasn't anything else found. Never heard from anyone. Figured maybe they got busy and we just let it go. Just last week we figured let's give them another shot because the service was great last time.... My husband called to find out how much brakes and rotors would cost us and they told him they would call him back with that info.... We never heard from them. Customer service isn't the greatest. Friendly service in person. Just don't expect a call back.

resp.text:
I'm sorry for not getting a call back. We are down 2 people in service department.  Can't find help. I know that is no excuse but I hope you come back and give us another chance.
If you have any other problems please call me Robert Taylor 256 735 6808 my personal cell

text: I went to integrity auto on yesterday because I was scared. I’m a single mom trying to provide for her family. This vehicle is my lifeline to work, food, church and pleasure. My engine light came on 11 days ago. I called them and the guy got me in there Immediately, took care of me ASAP, fixed the problem and sent me on my way. Christian based facility.... you guys and gals are God SENT!!! You rock.🤩🤩 I love me sum Integrity Automotive!!!

text: Our van broke down In Cullman while traveling from Huntsville to Birmingham. We were lucky to stumble upon Integrity. The local Enterprise has closed down so we had to rent a Uhaul to travel to Birmingham. The owner happily drove us to the local Uhaul and his team got to work on our vehicle. Thank you for going above and beyond!

resp.text: Thanks for the kind words

name: danielle johnson
text: EXCELLENT CUSTOMER SERVICE!! Highly satisfied with my visit. As a woman, most shops will try to take advantage but not this place. Everyone, from the mechanics to the customer service desk, was so kind. The mechanics took the time to explain what needed to be done to fix my car and even showed me what was wrong. I really appreciated that. I had to stay at the shop while they fixed my car, they knew I needed to get home by a certain time and they made sure to get me back on the road in that time frame. I will never go anywhere else. My encounter with everyone who works there definitely lived up to the business name. Thank you Integrity!!

name: Marilyn Stewart
text: So thankful to find a trustworthy place for vehicle repairs.  Nicest people you could ever deal with. Quality work.  Will surely use for all repairs.

text: My car died on the interstate. I called them and they had it towed to the shop. Timing belt broke. They are going to replace the engine which is going to be expensive but they are working with me on that. Everyone I've talked to had treated me with respect and have been very pleasant. I'll update this review when I get my car back.

name: Kelsie West
text: My husband took his truck here explaining the problem to begin with, when it was dropped off. $3,400 dollars later and over at the least one month later and that problem was never fixed (was not told that until pickup today) along with after picking it up smoke came from the tail pipe and the air conditioner is not blowing cold even though they took it upon themselves to service the AC and charging $89 for that without notice. Neither of those problems were occurring prior to dropping it off. Needless to say, the truck was dropped back off to them within 30 minutes of pickup. We will be speaking with the so called mechanic on Monday. They also have problems with taking and returning calls. The only good thing I can say is that the owner Robert was nice and friendly. Let’s just see if they can make this right and I will come back and edit this post. But for now I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS SHOP, PERIOD.

name: Tiffani Johnson
text: I can't say enough good things about this company! Awesome experience with them, they replaced front rotors and brake pads on our car. They were VERY honest through the whole process. Was in and out within an hour, they didn't gouge us either! Highly, highly recommend them for any of your automotive needs!

resp.text: Thank you so much and for your business to our shop.

name: The Smith’s
text: Run! I took my car in for a noise on with my passenger side, water coming into my floorboard and ac not cooling. They charged my extended warranty over $1700 to redo my ac and I paid another $1200 for my front end work. The first week I had my car back it started making an awful noise. I took my car to another mechanic and he found that Integrity put no bolts in one of my brakes and it fell behind the caliber. The mechanic said he couldn’t believe I didn’t have an accident. I took it back in 6/15 due to the ac pouring water and still having a front end noise. They had my car until the afternoon of the 19th and said they had everything fixed. We left for vacation the 20th and half way to our destination the ac started pouring water in the passenger floorboard when it’s on. I’ve had my car back since the 19th of June but it’s sat in my barn the past 3 weeks. My transmission light is now on and it won’t shift gears. I had ABSOLUTELY NO problems with my transmission prior to my car going there and my AC now leaks constantly. I’m to the point of getting an attorney. I saw it was a veteran owned business and being that my husband is a veteran as well, I thought it would be great to support them. This is the biggest mistake I could have made.

resp.text: Fake customer

text: You drop your car off seven or eight days later no one calls you they tell your car is done and it cost $2000 to fix they fix my car with no approval I said OK paid the bill picked it up less than 10 days later I start to hear funky noise like something is loose then transmission fluid starts pouring all out of it  end it won’t move they send a wrecker after it same thing car sits there for almost 4 weeks no one calls me tells me the car is done I come to pick it up drive home put about 400 miles on it guess what car won’t move call him they tell me to bring it in don’t even offer it to tow it back wake they came and got it finally Repeated the same thing 3Weeks later I called to check on my car how they say it’s ready to go said they had a fluid leak told me that park the car out front I come to pick it up it’s dark and raining guess what the car won’t start won’t crank nothing popped the hood the negative battery cable was loose reconnect it car still is dead as a hammer. It’s late it’s dark come back the next day car won’t even jumpstart the battery is so dead go to get a battery put a battery in it started and the emergency brake light won’t go off like they adjusted the emergency break wrong drive it home will never go back oh by the way when I went to pick it up the driver side floor board was full mud . Don’t take your car there

text: I contacted Alabama Precision Transmission to get an estimate on a new transmission for my Nissan. I spoke with Michael (Mike) and he worked hard and got me the best deal possible! He went above and beyond to get me what I needed and I would never go anywhere else!

text: Great guys to work with, great attention to detail and take pride in their work.

name: Kaitlyn Shotwell
text:
My car broke down about 20 miles south of Montgomery, and the Firestone on Maxwell AFB recommended this place as a reputable transmission specialist. My first impression walking in was not favorable, as the owners smoke indoors and it is not well maintained. I would say the highlight of this place is the employees, because they were super helpful and polite as my car was put into the garage. Be careful if you have insurance; once I brought up that my insurance might cover the work, the owner got really shady and kept telling me that it wasn't a good idea to contact my insurance company. I ended up leaving my car here for about a week and I heard no updates from the store and they wouldn't answer any phone calls. I decided I didn't want to conduct business with these folks anymore. When I finally got the owner on the phone, he protested that the job would cost me about $6,000, but calling around and showing the invoice to other mechanics in the area, they told me they would do the same job for about $4,000. I ended up having the car towed to the dealership because of the bad vibes I got with APT.

In summary, I cannot attest to their expertise fixing the car, but I definitely didn't like their low level of professionalism. Two and a half stars.

name: Tara Goode
text: Take forever to fix your car.

name: Jerry Campbell
text:
EarIier this year I had a 1987 S10 with a 350ci worked on for worked on for 30+ minutes  and was charged zero.  Dennis Morgan the service manager said the mechanic was unable to  improve it but also stated what needed to be done and if I needed them to let them know.  Thanks Dennis Morgan..

In August I returned with the same auto after someone else worked on it. They did the fine tuning for $25.50.  I should have used them for the complete repair instead of wasting alot of money and time? A very costly mistake on my part.

Thanks Dennis Morgan (Manger) and Jesse Simmons (Mechanic)

I would use them again and highly recommend them to anyone who wants to be treated fairly and needed help at a very fair price! They let you make the decisions and apply no pressure to get yor business! Its very hard to find a business like that today!

resp.text: Thanks for the high recommendation, Jerry. Happy we were able to help. Don't hesitate to reach out anytime you need our assistance again. All the best. - David Below

resp.text: I'm so glad we were able to help you out with your car, Greg. My team does their best to make sure our customers are well taken care of and that our work stays fast and exceptional. Thanks for the awesome rating, and if you ever need anything else we're here for you! -David Below

text: Good work

name: Richard Lynch
text: Not in business anymore

name: Tiffany Walls
text: I absolutely ADORE Brian and Tammy! They have serviced my Hyundiai Tucson as well as a second vehicle for our family. In August 2019, I had my AC compressor replaced. I had shopped around some other businesses (including Firestone, which I would NEVER recommend) and I was quoted a far more reasonable price for parts and labor through Brian's. Brian took the time to diagnose my issue, explain what he would do to my vehicle, how the part worked and why the part that needed replacing wasn't working properly. After the repair, Brian took the time to have me look and listen to the new part, showed me the broken part before he disposed of it and even gave me some insight to another belt that may need replacing at a certain point. They won us over with their communication, responsiveness, kindness and honesty. They have customers for life because they did such a stellar job! Wonderful experiences at this shop!

name: Ethan Lake
text: Absolutely the best experience I have had with a mechanic. I called several of the places around to see if I could bring my truck by and this was definitely the friendliest of them. Tammy answered my phone call and was beyond helpful. I instantly took the truck by and Brian greeted me as soon as I arrived. For the first time, a mechanic (Brian) actually took the time to hear me out and see what I thought the issue was. He checked various things in the truck and under the hood. He did a little tinkering and sent me on my way with no more problems! I will definitely be back, and for anyone else new to this area and looking for a place to get your vehicle fixed, go see Brian!

resp.text: Thank you Ethan!  We appreciate your review and look forward to helping you in the future.

name: john chafton
text: Highly recommend Brian's Automotive, Tammy and Brian are wonderful people and they take the time and listen to you. I have a 2004 Chevy Silver ado 4 wheel drive and he has changed the transmission for me and some other work and he does great work. He does stay busy so he may have to keep your vehicle a little longer than normal but its worth it. Thanks Tammy And Brian.

name: Bubba Holsomback
text: Brian is a great person first off and very honest. I highly recommend him. He’s gonna tell you EXACTLY what’s wrong with your car, but he also explains it to you in a way you can understand. Then will explain what’s going on, and what’s  being done to fix it.

name: Mike McKenna
text: I took my 1994 Chevy Z71 to Brian to fix a broken manifold bolt on the back passenger side. Very professional and knowledgeable with excellent follow up. He kept me posted and went over and above my expectations at a reasonable price. I will not hesitate to bring my other vehicles to Brian.

resp.text: Mike, we appreciate the opportunity to work on your truck.  We also appreciate the very kind review. Thank you!

text: Went to Brian by recommendation of a friend.  I have to say that may have been my best experience with a Mechanic.  He takes great pride in what he does and he treats people above and beyond friendly.  He is super easy to work with and doesn't try to add on extra expenses if not needed from a safety standpoint.  I would recommend Brian hands down!

resp.text: Thank you for the great review Dean!  We are so glad you found us.

resp.text: Thank you for allowing us to rebuild your LS1 1994 Corvette!  I enjoyed the process and we appreciate your business.

name: Zavier Cordova
text: At first glance everything seemed to be going well, but then out of nowhere more things needed to be fixed, the original price for the items started increasing and the time of the repairs took too long. I would not recommend this place to anybody.

resp.text: This vehicle was brought in not running with a blown engine. Installed good used motor, ran fine no power, catalytic converters were plugged. Advise customer and tried to find her two good used cats, because she couldn't afford new. Finally found to good used cats. Test drove car and it vibrated violently was un drivable.  She said she really had to have car an test drove it. Brought car back with right inner fender well ripped out of car? She said fix car. I put car on lift and found that someone tried to weld in ujoints? They have to be machine pressed.  I told her she needed a whole driveline. She squabbled alot and finally said I have no choice go ahead. I found her a good used driveline from California and when it came in I Installed it and she was able to pick up a good driving car! Everything was done right each step i had to make nothing i could of done differently!

name: T.C. Hill
text: I've used and my Family uses M&D. We've had no issues. I recommend M&D to ALL my friends an coworkers. He charges less than ANY shops in the area and does honest, qualiry work in a reasonable time frame.  You don't believe me get on the phone, get a estimate. See what else the other shops "Find while under the hood".  No I will stick with M&D.

name: Jason Welsh
text: Went to the glass doctor side, and had a windshield replacement. They did excellent work. I was in and out in no time. I have to say of everyone else I called they where the cheapest. But the service was quality.

name: patrick Timmons
text: I currently have my 2004 Pontiac vibe at md auto getting an engine swap initially the owner tried to call me several days to let me know he found an engine with 56k miles a rare find man I really appreciate him calling me I work 2 jobs and now they're doing an awesome job replacing my engine and they've been very nice when I call and ask questions and very informative

name: Sheryl Ledbetter
text:
I would advise anyone to stay away from there.
The owner scheduled us in get minor repairs done on a specific day. He quoted us a price that was higher than other places but we had to have something done in the shop next to him so we agreed. He was supposed to let the other person have our car by noon so he could get started on the job we wanted to have done. Not only did he not have the car done by noon but rather at 4pm, also he didn't finish the job and charged us double the money he quoted he would charge for both repairs.
This is my second bad experience with him, I had a bad feeling about him but I thought I could get these easy things done so he could move our car along to the guy next door in a timely fashion.
Never again.

resp.text:
Sometimes you have to wonder who your really speaking to. This car a 2000 Mercedes Benz S430 was scheduled to have her windows tinted next door to me and when she showed up late to her appointment and couldn't get her car done that day she asked me if I could go ahead a replace her passenger mirror & that the new one was in a box in the back seat & then change her oil the oil was also in the back seat in a bag. I told her I would and gave her a quote of 70 dollars to do both. When I started the Job around 2 oclock I found that  someone had taken a big tube of glue and poured it all over the inner mounting guts of the mirror assembly to glue it back on the car, this was not told to me when I gave her a estimate.  I tried contacting her and was un able to , then she showed up at four when I was just finishing her mirror , but hadn't changed her oil yet and told her that I wouldn't have time now to change it , but showed her and her boyfriend the extra work I had to do to save the wires safely getting the connectors apart and getting the mounting screws out without hurting the heads   because of the glue mess someone had made. Her car was also suppose to go to the window tint shop in the morning at 10:00am but she failed to get it there on time and by 10:30 Anthony had to leave and told her her car would now not be done that day he had other jobs he had to do first since she missed her appointment , but she could leave it and he would have it done tomorrow morning she was nasty pushed on getting it done that day then said forget it , then called him back and said ok. The job calls for an hour of labor I ended up spending 2 hours because of the glue and charged her for 1 hour and this is what she thinks she can do to repay the favor and on top of it her they only paid me 50 dollars and I just let it go! P/s she also quoted this was her second time using me and the fact is this was the first time. She bought her car from a used car lot and I was asked to do some repairs on it from the dealer , but never did the work.  Like I said you never know who your really talking to , but I will be praying for her heart issue is attended to by my loving God and that she maybe able to share the love He gave through me to her someday by the Grace/forgiveness/Love I gave her for her ungodly ways this day!
God is Good all the time Amen Let's keep loving even when people are mean!

text: I highly recommend Moates Auto Xchange! Jordan was awesome and went above and beyond for us. We were at another dealership and called to see what he could do for us. He got us a better deal on a better car, so we drove 2 and a half hours to get it! !We will go there from now on to buy!

name: Brent Vance
text:
Worked with Mitch here and was not disappointed. He didn’t BS me or tried to conceal any information.

He also let me come after hours to see a car and then stayed an additional 3 hours after closing to work finance terms on my 2013 Elantra.

The car is very clean and they put a lot of miscellaneous service work that I requested before I picked it up a couple days later.

I highly recommend this business.

resp.text: Thank you Mr. Vance! Dont forget to come back for your free Oil Change!

name: Len Gordon
text: My wife and I purchased a used Tahoe from them. We dealt with Jordan during the purchase. I have purchased several used vehicles that items were given a "Band Aid" to hide problems and that did not occur here. Overall I feel they were honest and did not try to hide anything from us. I came with a change of clothes and gloves to go through the vehicle myself, instead they let me go through the car on one of their racks. The vehicle checked out as we had discussed. Also, I might add that I feel like Jordan really put in the extra effort to ensure he earned our business. The paperwork and transaction was simple and very straight forward.

resp.text:
Thank you guys, it was a pleasure to meet you.  We look forward
to helping you and your friends in the future.  Dale Moates

name: David Giles
text: Bought a gorgeous low mileage Miata from Jordan and crew.  They were very friendly and honest and the vehicle was just as described except for one minor issue.  I had been told it had a new battery, but during inspection we discovered that the battery was not new. It was just a mix-up and they were happy to install a new battery while we were finishing up the financial side of the deal.  Would have loved to have gotten the car at a bit lower price (who wouldn't?) but this was an exceptional low-mileage one-owner specimen, and they did work with me on the price.  I've shopped Miatas for quite some time and lately Carvana seems to have almost cornered the market on clean low-mileage Miatas and have jacked the prices up really high.  But I was able to buy this Miata well below what Carvana would have priced it at, and I feel that I got a good deal considering the current market and the premium condition of this vehicle  (and lots of buyers have had very bad experiences with Carvana, so I'm glad I didn't have to deal with them).  Highly recommend Moates Auto Xchange and would absolutely do business with them again!

resp.text: Thank you Mr Giles for the review.  We appreciate your kind words, yes Carvana is not what everyone thinks it is, I've heard nothing but horror stories and that "return policy" is quite the scam.  Enjoy that beautiful Miata.

name: AJ Nashville
text: Ive had incredible luck with Moates. As an out of state buyer you typically run into questions that most local buyers dont have. Simply because you cannot see the car first hand. Ive always ran into an issue that when I showed up at other places to pick up my nice new car, its never what I expected it to be. Thats not the case with Moates. The staff there has been extremely forth coming and honest when it comes to small things like dings and scratches on a car. This way when I arrive, I know what to expect. My next car will come from here, its a drive but its one that I see as well worth the time. Thanks Moates for an awesome car buying experience!

name: S. Berlet
text: We bought a great car at a great price from an awesome sales person! Thank you Jordan McDonald for an incredible and quick car buying experience.

name: Rev. Clayton Lassiter
text: I bought my wife her 2018 Sonata and got a great deal from Dale and the team. I would and probably will buy again and I live 3 hours away now!

resp.text: Satsuma, I'm so glad I was able to help you and your wife find the perfect car! Whenever we can help, don't hesitate to stop by or give us a call. -Dale M., Business Owner

name: Jodi Berger
text: How dare you assume that we are ungrateful. My husband gave them more than half for the vehicle. It was NOT at no cost. This is not about the church, who helped us tremendously during hard times. That was pretty low of you. You sold the vehicle "as is," I understood what that meant. My husband was warned "do not drive it very far." After a week, a main component (the fly wheel and belt), literally fell out of the vehicle while I was driving. I lost all power. I and/or my husband or someone else could have been fatally injured. The reason for what happened was that it was improperly torqued. We would have been back to not having a vehicle. Only the parts that you replaced were new, everything else had to be replaced from factory parts. Hadn't you even done a tune up? The filters were all factory. Like I said, "as is," but it should have been thoroughly inspected by a mechanic. Most likely, you only did what was necessary to pass the inspection. Do not assume that because I'm female that I don't know anything about cars. I do, I was the owner of a NASCAR in the '80s and raced with the legends. You wanted an edit, this is what happened and your response was shameful.

resp.text:
As clearly stated on the CARFAX history service records. 7/3/18  Control Arms, Ball Joints, and Sway Bar links and alignment. All Parts replaced were new OEM quality, I have the receipts.  Repair order #19147  anyone disputing that is misleading you, btw.

This work was done prior to your "acquisition."

I say "acquisition" because you DID NOT buy / purchase ANYTHING. This old (but clean) 1996 SUV was as a GIFT to you at NO COST by a charitable group of church members to help you, to give you a way to go.  You paid for NOTHING for that vehicle (which given to you) well over a year ago.
If you "could have BOUGHT a brand new car" why did you need others to pool their money to GIVE you an SUV?

Rethink who you call "Swindlers" next time you decide to get mad because your 23 year old vehicle might need some maintenance.

I'll give you the opportunity to edit your review and apologize for your comments and misleading review.  Only actual customers leave reviews and comments per Google's Policy and you have never spent $1 here.  You are NOT a customer and obviously you are NOT thankful either.

P.S.  If anyone who works with charitable organizations and give their time and money to help others, please do not let "this example" deter you from your heart's desires and work.  Most people are very thankful.

name: Doyle Bright
text:
Mr T's automotive strives to satisfy the customer Matt Tortorici is very knowledgeable he has been working with cars and building engines from back in the mid 70's .  I had a coolant leakage problem with my GMC 1500 Sierria 5.3 liter Truck.  GM used defective castech heads casting#706 from 2002 thru 2007 they were made in China. The heads will crack at the head bolts causing coolant to leak into engine. GM would not fix the Issue and had multiple other shops in the Birmingham area try and repair the same old casting 706 and it would last for around 60k miles and crack again.  We put casting 243 heads on my 2002 5.3 liter
and so far so good it seems to have lost little low end but picked up some upper end power. Matt went over everything with me and even steamed cleaned my engine also repaired my AC.  I highly recommend Mr T's / Matt Tortorici he didi exceleent job on my Truck.. MShelto

resp.text:
Do you know the legal liability you have imposed on yourself by posting a malicious business review with a fake Google account? You should look it up. With that said here is our reply to your review.
I am sorry you are having an issue after the repair but an engine replacement is just that, the engine along with any extra parts that we felt were questionable and they are listed on your invoice. There is not an ECM on your invoice. Please keep in mind that there are several other things under the hood of your car that can also cause future problems. Unfortunately we are not able to detect a component such as an ECM, starter, alternator, Oxygen Sensor, Injector and so on that is about to go bad, it is just impossible. Your vehicle is 11 years old and does have 175,000 miles on and usually parts and components will begin to fail and need replacing after 10 years. This ECM is not covered under warranty because we did not replace this part and it does not come with an engine. I have copied and pasted some information for you that came from a site called my mechanic explaining the ECM’s function to your car. We have ordered the ECM, as you know, and as soon as it is installed and the car is test drove we will call you.
Here is some information that I pulled from the site "My Mechanic" that may help you better understand an ECM's function.
The engine control module (ECM), also commonly referred to as the engine control unit (ECU) or powertrain control module (PCM), is one of the most important components found on virtually all  vehicles. It essentially functions as the main computer for many of the vehicle’s engine performance and drivability functions. The ECM takes the information from the engine's various sensors and uses that information to calculate and tune engine spark and fuel for maximum power and efficiency. Erratic engine behavior also indicates a bad or failing ECM. A faulty computer may cause the vehicle to intermittently stall or misfire. The symptoms might come and go and not appear to have any sort of pattern to their frequency or severity. The ECM plays a vital role in engine performance. Any issues with it can cause major problems with the overall functionality of the car.

name: Soul Jah
text:
WARNING! WARNING! ...Avoid at all cost!! This business is not what they claim they are. My P30 Step Van was towed in to get a refreshing and almost had to be towed away. I heard their ad on the radio, gave them a call and found out they service Cintas vans. I spoke to the owner Matt on the phone and he assured me that he was the place to come to and he would take care of me. I told him what I wanted done, I also left a list with the most important to be taken care of first (fuel tank leak and master cylinder replacement) with the receptionist. I mentioned new tires but didn’t decide what to install, but he did, and installed them without my consent. Later he said he thought that’s what I wanted “the cheap ones.” He decided to do what he wanted and void my concerns (that I spoke of on every visit). I was charged over $400.00 in parts (radiator, v belt and lug nuts) plus labor @ $74/hour added without my consent nor were they spoken of when I made payments in person. I was charged ($35.00) for an air cleaner that he had left from a previous vehicle and promised that he wouldn’t charge me for since I was getting so much work done. That Monday of week three, I stopped by to realize no work had been done over the past 5 days and I immediately stopped the work and told them I would be back in the morning to pick up and pay off balance. Next morning I waited over and hour for the motor to be pressure washed like he promised it would be done yesterday by lunch. While waiting he then decided that he would for free replace the master cylinder and patch the fuel tank leak with a $6.00 putty instead of replacing the tank like I asked on day one. All while repairs being done there were no actual receipt/list of parts and labor but guesstimations made until I made final payment. After I reviewed the receipt just before I paid the remaining $1,400+ balance I had to request that Matt break down and fix the double charges on receipt (I was so angry that I missed a few issues on the receipt). A week turned into a month and if I had not stopped the work there’s no telling how long it would have taken to get the van back. Now I’m weeks behind schedule on preparing for the van for body work and getting it wrapped.   The total cost was $3,863.68 and $1,417.25 of it was labor. I felt robbed and played. This place is not worthy of your money and will waste your time…. so please be advised! You are WARNED!!
CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS

H Russell Adair II
White 1984 Chevrolet P30 Step Van

P.S.
I was charged $30.00 for brake fluid even though he knew the master cylinder was bad. I realized this after I paid. Also, the paper work was drawn up and balance paid before he decided to replace master cylinder.
Matt told me the only man allowed to work on my vehicle had taken off several days due to court date and illness hence why the time frame was pushed back.
He spoke negatively about customers in front of me while they were on hold with the receptionist who also was not professional.

name: Joe Shultz
text:
I went there for a new water pump for a Chevy SUV. A new water pump was installed, but didn't last 100 miles. I returned the vehicle only to have the auto shop refuse to replace the water pump free of charge. I removed the water pump that weekend to find they cross threaded the new water pump and warped the unit. No wonder it did not function properly. After re-tapping a couple of screws and several hours out of my Saturday I replaced the new pump myself. Now I am out the price of another water pump, thanks a lot.

Many people do not know this, but each repair job has an attached amount of time associated with it. So, if an auto center changes your brakes in 30 min but the book says it takes 1.5 hours, then the shop charges you for the extra hour as an extra rake. Now, I do not mind paying the extra as long as the quality matches. This shop may do quick work, but it is not at the quality I am paying for. Poor value given, and they would not make it right either. Basically the repair guy did not remove all the necessary components (like a radiator) to save some time and shoved the water pump in at an angle.

I will never use them again.

name: Heather M
text: Griffin is a lifesaver! My truck blew a spark plug and I had two kids with me along with my husband. We were about 300 miles from home! I thought we were stranded and repair was going to cost a fortune. Griffin used his OWN vehicle to drive 3 exits up to assist us. He was able to get the undamaged spark plug back in and also brought us a brand new coil pack and put it in. He did this repair out of the kindness of his heart and we cannot thank him enough! He was honest from the get go. He could have told us the truck needed a new head or worse and made a ton of money, but he fixed the problem quickly and didn't charge us a fractuon of what he could have! Thank you Griffin, you were our Angel! His shop may be behind sometimes, but he is worth the wait if you want an honest mechanic!

name: Sheree Lewis
text: New owner, great guy great work! I recommend this place for all your auto work .

name: Travis Gibbs
text:
I brought my car and truck to them when they first opened. They fixed both and stuck to fair estimate.

I wouldn't do business with them now after my last experience.

Month 1 & 2
Our car needed a new engine. The shop owner wanted to get an engine from his supplying junkyard. He missed one that became available. This process took about 2 weeks before we decided to find an engine ourselves which he was not happy with but agreed to. He said they could have it put in within a 3 day period. The engine company we bought from needed it done in 10 days for warranty purposes. Griffith used all of the 10 days to because other cars came in front of me while we had to wait on engine. They finally got it in and started but had to send to dealership because the car went into anti-theft mode and wouldn't start. We had to actually arrange the drop off to the dealership ourselves. I feel like we were running his business for him because he was almost never there. The employees even mentioned that problem in passing.

Month 3
We become worried after not hearing anything from dealership or Griffin for about 2.5ish weeks. I had to contact dealership for them to tell me that they told Griffin that the car needed a major fuse panel that could be $1200+. I called Griffin to tell him I approved the install because we really needed the car. It's month 3 folks!

Is it Month 4? Getting close anyway.
We had to go ourselves to the dealership to confront them about not getting to our car. This should be Griffin's job. The dealership says that the part didn't fix the problem. Car still doesn't work. We decide to give up because the car needed another part for $2400 to "maybe" fix. We decide to just give up. Dealership is trying to get more money from us even though they didn't fix the problem. Griffin is trying to put that on us. We said we would pay for his time, but does this seem fair? Griffin himself might be a knowledgable mechanic, but he is a rookie business owner with no organization or management skills of his people.  He wasted a huge amount of our time (3+months), money ($6000+) and stressed my wife and I to no end. We are going to have to scrap our car with a new engine that doesn't run.

They do good oil changes and put a muffler on another car we brought, but he also made me pay for the part up front which shows bad business to me as well.

* FINAL RESULT
paid griffin $1400 because the car ended up not working out. He said he made no money and it would have been $2000 if it had worked + whatever it would be to charge AC. When we walked in to pay he didn't even recognize us. My wife and I talked to this guy several times in person and on phone. The waiting area had mice running around too FYI if you are scared of them. After that we went to the dealer shop that had our car and basically gave it to the tech working on it. he paid for the dealer work and gave us a little cash. When we went to clean the car out I noticed that the driver seat leather looked very dirty and worn. Griffin said he was sorry.

text: I am honestly disappointed, this shop has Amazing POTENTIAL. However, I don't feel it is being ran efficiently. I have called with no answer, mupltiple occasions. I also have the concern of the child/childern that are running through shop all day, most days. I have also had to keep from hitting many toys, many times. I believe the shop is in an amazing location, and again has all potential in the wprld. Unfourtnally, right now, I wouldn't recommend it.

name: Chris Ruffin
text:
I moved to McCalla in March of 2015. I was looking for a dependable repair shop that did quality work and that I could become a repeat customer with. I chose Griffin Automotive because they are ASE certified and after using them with 3 vehicles (06 Nissan Altima, 05 Chevy Silverado, & 2015 Nissan Altima) I have had no complaints with them.

They do great work, and are realistic with their estimates. If you are looking for a repair shop with a quick turnaround (meaning hours instead of days) then this may not be the shop for you, but I have a spare vehicle and can leave the vehicle for repairs.  They typically tell me that they have other vehicles in front of mine, but will look at it as soon as they get a free moment. I have sent my cars or truck to them at least 9 times (using both the overnight drop box and just bringing it in) and have only waited longer than a day once (and that was because the part got their late in the evening and I picked it up after work the next day)

I have had multiple types of jobs: brakes pads for Altima and Silverado, rotors for Altima and Silverado,, brake drums for Silverado, oil change for Altima and Silverado, window regulator replacement on Silverado, oil leak repair on Altima, engine mounts on Altima, transfer case replacement Silverado 4x4, along with other normal maintenance type items

name: Joel Banyai
text: In the past few months I've had work done and sent multiple friends to this shop. They've fixed cars other shops won't touch (or messed up), and saved my friends and I a ton of money. We all know warranty work doesn't pay the bills, but when an alternator they had rebuilt and installed failed, they had a new alternator swapped in the next morning. On another repair they offered a good used part they had on hand for much cheaper instead of charging for a brand new part. Another car had a strange symptom; they correctly diagnosed two cascading failures up the line and fixed everything. If a repair isn't going to be cost effective, they'll tell you that too.  I'm extremely pleased. You won't go wrong going here.

name: Robert Robb
text: Charged me $400 to fix a bad wire going to the AC clutch (no parts).  At $85/hour that means it took them almost 5 hrs to fix.  I had looked at the problem before I brought the car in and had narrowed it down to the AC clutch so I asked when i pick it up if it was on the ground or power side.  He wouldn't tell me .  When I looked under the car I could see where they used a wire jumper like whats used for connecting trailer lights to connect to another ground wire that must have been good.  I had expected 2 to 3 hundred but with the mechanic refusing to answer a simple question left me questioning.

name: Jovan Coates
text: Russell Brothers Auto is the best repair shop in this city hands down.  I have been having my vehicles serviced there for over ten years.  They have kept things running that others have said could not be fixed, or a dealership suggests that it's time to purchase another vehicle.   They work on any make and model of vehicle and can perform any type of maintenance from fluid changes, up to engine replacement.  The staff is friendly and the service top notch.  They have always had my vehicles ready the same day I drop them off.  The value cannot be beat.  They do not suggest needless services just to pad an invoice, if your car is not running or something electrical doesn't work, they will immediately get to the heart of the problem and take care of it.  They stand by their work and I will wholeheartedly recommend to anyone if you need your car repaired take it to Russell Brothers, you won't be disappointed.

resp.text: Thanks so kindly!!!

name: LiqwdE Teryx 4LE (LiqwdE)
text: So far so good. Very understanding. They helped budget my repairs into 3 visit depending on severity of problems. As long as people remember most problems can't be solved same day. Good mechanics, not miracle workers!

resp.text: Appreciate you very much. Thank you for being our customer!

name: Briana Wright
text:
If I could rate it at half a star I would. Avoid this place like the Ebola.
Though Ebola Might be easier to deal with than these clowns.
* NO Communication.
* NO Realistic estimate.
* NO Time frame for repairs to be completed.
* NO Call to authorize ordering of expensive parts.
* NO Friendly service, in fact, acted as if simple questions were a bother to answer, and indeed were NOT answered.

In the End I had my Car towed away to take to elsewhere.. where the car was fixed, and on the road the next day, for the same price as I was charged by these yahoos for ripping apart my dashboard.

name: Thomas Taylor
text:
These guys will fix those cars that no one else will even touch. They repair a Porsche Cayenne (a real PIB to fix) to a 20 year old beater that most would charge more than the car is worth.

The guy that was crabbing about his experience...., If you say "Fix it!" they will fix it. If you say tell me what is wrong and how much, then they will do that as well. BTW, it cost $$ to diagnose and this is sometimes the most expensive part of a repair. Communication is key and it goes both ways.

These guys are about the only honest ones left. They are so good that many dealers around town bring their used cars to them because their own mechanics can neither fix nor diagnose what is wrong with them. Or maybe they just don't want to get their hands dirty!
Jim and his guys will get greasy and keep you on the road!

resp.text: Kind words and much appreciated!

text: I asked for a quote for two sides. I was given a price. I asked if that was the price for both sides. He said yes. Later, after already doing one side, he tells me that it was the price for one side and questioned if I wanted the other side done. I said I would pay for both sides if they took care of the alignment. He said they would. I got the vehicle, immediately noticed the horrible alignment, had it inspected, and was told that the alignment was, as I suspected, terrible.

name: kristi gibbons
text: We've had one good experience with these folks and two bad ones. They have some skilled electrical technicians capable of figuring out difficult electrical issues. Unfortunately, the company WILL take advantage of you financiallly given the opportunity. They failed to honor a warranty on a part they replaced. Another time they overcharged for correcting an easily diagnosable connection problem in the ignition system. No parts were replaced, probably less than an hour of labor was involved, and the bill was a few hundred dollars. When I politely questioned them on the bill, the guy became agitated, tried to change the subject, explained how I was lucky they didn't charge much more to get my car back.
